item.title: Import Large Datasets Into R
item.description: Overview Many R-users rely on the dplyr or read.table packages to import their datasets as a dataframe. Although this works well for relatively small datasets, we recommend using the data.table R package instead because it is significantly faster. This building block provides you with some practical tips for dealing with large datsets in R. Code As a starting point, make sure to clean your working environment in RStudio. Oftentimes, there are datasets stored memory that you have worked with earlier but you’re no longer using.

item.title: Clean Data Scraped From Social Media
item.description: Overview This is a handy function that can be used to clean social media data scraped from the web. Usually, when scraping social media, the output data can contain letters like K’s (Thousands), M’s (Millions) and B’s (Billions). item.title: Data Preparation and Workflow Management
item.description: The Data Preparation and Workflow Management course is an open-source Master level course taught at Tilburg University. All of its content is freely available and consists of lectures, live streams, self-study material, tutorials and examples. This course teaches you how to engineer data sets for statistical analysis. Many students and researchers perceive the process of “creating” a data set for analysis as rather simplistic: a bit of cleaning here, a bit of merging there, and you’re done.
